fields.evidence_type: Copy-number loss content
fields.evidence: 1A. Contains protein-coding or other known functionally important elements.
fields.category: Section 1: Initial assessment of genomics content

fields.evidence_type: Copy-number loss content
fields.evidence: 1B. Does NOT contain protein-coding or any known functionally important elements.
fields.category: Section 1: Initial assessment of genomics content

fields.evidence_type: Overlap with ESTABLISHED HI genes or genomic regions and consideration of reason for referral
fields.evidence: 2A. Complete overlap of an established HI gene/genomic region.
fields.category: Section 2: Overlap with established/predicted haploinsufficiency (HI) or established benign genes/genomic regions (Skip to Section 3 if your copy-number loss DOES NOT overlap these types of genes/regions)

fields.evidence_type: Overlap with ESTABLISHED HI genes or genomic regions and consideration of reason for referral
fields.evidence:
2B. Partial overlap of an established HI genomic region.

- The observed CNV does NOT contain the known causative gene or critical region for this established HI genomic region OR
- Unclear if known causative gene or critical region is affected OR
- No specific causative gene or critical region has been established for this HI genomic region.
fields.category: Section 2: Overlap with established/predicted haploinsufficiency (HI) or established benign genes/genomic regions (Skip to Section 3 if your copy-number loss DOES NOT overlap these types of genes/regions)

fields.evidence_type: Overlap with ESTABLISHED HI genes or genomic regions and consideration of reason for referral
fields.evidence: 2C. Partial overlap with the 5' end of an established HI gene (3' end of the gene not involved)...
fields.category: Section 2: Overlap with established/predicted haploinsufficiency (HI) or established benign genes/genomic regions (Skip to Section 3 if your copy-number loss DOES NOT overlap these types of genes/regions)

fields.evidence_type: Overlap with ESTABLISHED HI genes or genomic regions and consideration of reason for referral
fields.evidence: 2C-1. ...and coding sequence is involved.
fields.category: Section 2: Overlap with established/predicted haploinsufficiency (HI) or established benign genes/genomic regions (Skip to Section 3 if your copy-number loss DOES NOT overlap these types of genes/regions)

fields.evidence_type: Overlap with ESTABLISHED HI genes or genomic regions and consideration of reason for referral
fields.evidence: 2C-2. ...and only the 5' UTR is involved.
fields.category: Section 2: Overlap with established/predicted haploinsufficiency (HI) or established benign genes/genomic regions (Skip to Section 3 if your copy-number loss DOES NOT overlap these types of genes/regions)

fields.evidence_type: Overlap with ESTABLISHED HI genes or genomic regions and consideration of reason for referral
fields.evidence: 2D. Partial overlap with the 3' end of an established HI gene (5' end of the gene not involved)...
fields.category: Section 2: Overlap with established/predicted haploinsufficiency (HI) or established benign genes/genomic regions (Skip to Section 3 if your copy-number loss DOES NOT overlap these types of genes/regions)

fields.evidence_type: Overlap with ESTABLISHED HI genes or genomic regions and consideration of reason for referral
fields.evidence: 2D-1. ...and only the 3' untranslated region is involved.
fields.category: Section 2: Overlap with established/predicted haploinsufficiency (HI) or established benign genes/genomic regions (Skip to Section 3 if your copy-number loss DOES NOT overlap these types of genes/regions)

fields.evidence_type: Overlap with ESTABLISHED HI genes or genomic regions and consideration of reason for referral
fields.evidence: 2D-2. ...and only the last exon is involved. Other established pathogenic variants have been reported in this exon.
fields.category: Section 2: Overlap with established/predicted haploinsufficiency (HI) or established benign genes/genomic regions (Skip to Section 3 if your copy-number loss DOES NOT overlap these types of genes/regions)

fields.evidence_type: Overlap with ESTABLISHED HI genes or genomic regions and consideration of reason for referral
fields.evidence: 2D-3. ...and only the last exon is involved. No other established pathogenic variants have been reported in this exon.
fields.category: Section 2: Overlap with established/predicted haploinsufficiency (HI) or established benign genes/genomic regions (Skip to Section 3 if your copy-number loss DOES NOT overlap these types of genes/regions)

fields.evidence_type: Overlap with ESTABLISHED HI genes or genomic regions and consideration of reason for referral
fields.evidence: 2D-4. ...and it includes other exons in addition to the last exon. Nonsense-mediated decay is expected to occur.
fields.category: Section 2: Overlap with established/predicted haploinsufficiency (HI) or established benign genes/genomic regions (Skip to Section 3 if your copy-number loss DOES NOT overlap these types of genes/regions)

fields.evidence_type: Overlap with ESTABLISHED HI genes or genomic regions and consideration of reason for referral
fields.evidence: 2E. Both breakpoints are within the same gene (intragenic CNV; gene-level sequence variant).
fields.suggested:
See ClinGen SVI working group PVS1 specifications

- PVS1 = 0.90
- PVS1_Strong = 0.45
- PVS1_Moderate or PM4 (in-frame indels) = 0.30
- PVS1_Supporting = 0.15
-N/A = 0 but continue evaluation
fields.category: Section 2: Overlap with established/predicted haploinsufficiency (HI) or established benign genes/genomic regions (Skip to Section 3 if your copy-number loss DOES NOT overlap these types of genes/regions)

fields.evidence_type: Overlap with ESTABLISHED benign genes or genomic regions
fields.evidence: 2F. Completely contained within an established benign CNV region.
fields.category: Section 2: Overlap with established/predicted haploinsufficiency (HI) or established benign genes/genomic regions (Skip to Section 3 if your copy-number loss DOES NOT overlap these types of genes/regions)

fields.evidence_type: Overlap with ESTABLISHED benign genes or genomic regions
fields.evidence: 2G. Overlaps an established benign CNV, but includes additional genomic material.
fields.category: Section 2: Overlap with established/predicted haploinsufficiency (HI) or established benign genes/genomic regions (Skip to Section 3 if your copy-number loss DOES NOT overlap these types of genes/regions)

fields.evidence_type: Haploinsufficiency predictors
fields.evidence: 2H. Two or more HI predictors suggest that AT LEAST ONE gene in the interval is HI.
fields.category: Section 2: Overlap with established/predicted haploinsufficiency (HI) or established benign genes/genomic regions (Skip to Section 3 if your copy-number loss DOES NOT overlap these types of genes/regions)

fields.evidence_type: Number of protein-coding RefSeq genes wholly or partially included in the copy-number loss
fields.evidence: 3A. 0-24 genes
fields.category: Section 3: Evaluation of Gene Number

fields.evidence_type: Number of protein-coding RefSeq genes wholly or partially included in the copy-number loss
fields.evidence: 3B. 25-34 genes
fields.category: Section 3: Evaluation of Gene Number

fields.evidence_type: Number of protein-coding RefSeq genes wholly or partially included in the copy-number loss
fields.evidence: 3C. 35+ genes
fields.category: Section 3: Evaluation of Gene Number

fields.evidence_type: Individual case evidence - de novo occurrences
fields.evidence:
Reported proband (from literature, public databases, or internal lab data) has either:

- A complete deletion of a LOF variant within gene encompassed by the observed copy-number loss OR
- An overlapping copy-number loss similar in genomic content to the observed copy number loss...

AND...
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Individual case evidence - de novo occurrences
fields.evidence: 4A. ...the reported phenotype is highly specific and relatively unique to the gene or genomic region
fields.suggested:
Confirmed de novo: 0.45 points each

Assumed de novo: 0.30 points each (range: 0.15 to 0.45)
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Individual case evidence - de novo occurrences
fields.evidence: 4B. ...the reported phenotype is consistent with the gene/genomic region, is highly specific, but not necessarily unique to the gene/genomic region.
fields.suggested:
Confirmed de novo: 0.30 points each

Assumed de novo: 0.15 point each (range: 0 to 0.45)
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Individual case evidence - de novo occurrences
fields.evidence: 4C. ...the reported phenotype is consistent with the gene/genomic region, but not highly specific and/or with high genetic heterogeneity
fields.suggested:
Confirmed de novo: 0.15 points each

Assumed de novo: 0.10 points each (range: 0 to 0.30)
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Individual case evidence - inconsistent phenotype
fields.evidence: 4D. ...the reported phenotype is NOT consistent with what is expected for the gene/genomic region or not consistent in general.
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Individual case evidence - unknown inheritance
fields.evidence: 4E. Reported proband has a highly specific phenotype consistent with the gene/genomic region, but the inheritance of the variant is unknown.
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Individual case evidence - segregation among similarly affected family members
fields.evidence: 4F. 3-4 observed segregations
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Individual case evidence - segregation among similarly affected family members
fields.evidence: 4G. 5-6 observed segregations
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Individual case evidence - segregation among similarly affected family members
fields.evidence: 4H. 7 or more observed segregations
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Individual case evidence - nonsegregations
fields.evidence: 4I. Variant is NOT found in another individual in the proband's family AFFECTED with a consistent, specific, well-defined phenotype (no known phenocopies)
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Individual case evidence - nonsegregations
fields.evidence: 4J. Variant IS found in another individual in the proband's family UNAFFECTED with the specific, well-defined phenotype observed in the proband
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Individual case evidence - nonsegregations
fields.evidence: 4K: Variant IS found in another individual in the proband's family UNAFFECTED with the nonspecific phenotype observed in the proband.
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Case-control and population evidence
fields.evidence: 4L. Statistically significant increase amongst observations in cases (with a consistent, specific, well-defined phenotype) compared with controls.
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Case-control and population evidence
fields.evidence: 4M. Statistically significant increase amongst observations in cases (without a consistent, non-specific phenotype OR unknown phenotype) compared with controls.
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Case-control and population evidence
fields.evidence: 4N. No statistically significant difference between observations in cases and controls
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Case-control and population evidence
fields.evidence: 4O. Overlap with common population variation.
fields.suggested:
-1 if one CNV at >1% population (benign)

-0.9 if more than 2 CNVs at <1% population (likely benign)
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Case-control and population evidence
fields.evidence: 4P. Absent from population databases (or at extremely low frequency if recessive).
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Autosomal recessive variants only
fields.evidence: 4Q. Number of affected patients variant has been detected in trans with another pathogenic/likely pathogenic/VUS variant
fields.suggested:
Points per proband calculated as per Local Amendments in SOP.
0.5 points - Strength to apply 0.15
1.0 points - Strength to apply 0.30
2.0 points - Strength to apply 0.45
4.0 points - Strength to apply 0.90
fields.category: Section 4: Detailed evaluation of genomic content using cases from published literature, public databases, and/or internal lab data

fields.evidence_type: Observed copy-number loss is de novo
fields.evidence: 5A. Use appropriate category from de novo scoring section in section 4.
fields.suggested: Use de novo scoring categories from section 4 (4A-4C) to determine score
fields.category: Section 5: Evaluation of inheritance pattern/family history for patient being studied

fields.evidence_type: Observed copy-number loss is inherited
fields.evidence: 5B. Patient with specific, well-defined phenotype and no family history. CNV is inherited from an apparently unaffected parent.
fields.category: Section 5: Evaluation of inheritance pattern/family history for patient being studied

fields.evidence_type: Observed copy-number loss is inherited
fields.evidence: 5C. Patient with nonspecific phenotype and no family history. CNV is inherited from an apparently unaffected parent.
fields.category: Section 5: Evaluation of inheritance pattern/family history for patient being studied

fields.evidence_type: Observed copy-number loss is inherited
fields.evidence: 5D. CNV segregates with a consistent phenotype observed in the patient's family
fields.suggested: Use segregation scoring categories from section 4 (4F-4H) to determine score
fields.category: Section 5: Evaluation of inheritance pattern/family history for patient being studied

fields.evidence_type: Observed copy-number loss - nonsegregations
fields.evidence: 5E. Use appropriate category from nonsegregation section in section 4.
fields.suggested: Use nonsegregation scoring categories from section 4 (4I-4K) to determine score
fields.category: Section 5: Evaluation of inheritance pattern/family history for patient being studied

fields.evidence_type: Other
fields.evidence: 5F. Inheritance information is unavailable or uninformative.
fields.category: Section 5: Evaluation of inheritance pattern/family history for patient being studied

fields.evidence_type: Other
fields.evidence: 5G. Inheritance information is unavailable or uninformative. The patient phenotype is nonspecific, but is consistent with what has been described in similar cases.
fields.category: Section 5: Evaluation of inheritance pattern/family history for patient being studied

fields.evidence_type: Other
fields.evidence: 5H. Inheritance information is unavailable or uninformative. The patient phenotype is highly specific and consistent with what has been described in similar cases.
fields.category: Section 5: Evaluation of inheritance pattern/family history for patient being studied

fields.evidence_type: Other criteria from SNV variant interpretation guidelines
fields.evidence: 6A. Please give which SNV code this relates to e.g. PS4_moderate
fields.suggested:
Appropriate score based on the range:
+/- 0.15 (supporting)
+/- 0.3 (moderate)
+/- 0.45 (strong)
+/- 0.90 (very strong)
fields.category: Section 6: Other criteria from SNV variant interpretation guidelines
